Structure.Name: EHF Get Evidence Response
Structure.Description: Document type used to respond to a get evidence request

Element.Name: Customization Identifier
Element.Description: Identifies a user-defined customization of UBL for a specific use.

Element.Name: Profile Identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the business process context in which the transaction appears. It enables the buyer to process the invoice in an appropriate way.

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: An identification of the specification containing the total set of rules regarding semantic content, cardinalities and business rules to which the data contained in the instance document conforms. The identification may include the version of the specification as well as any customizations applied. Use UUID (universally unique identifier), version 4

Element.Name: Ted/Doffin reference
Element.Description: Ted or Doffin reference number

Element.Name: Issue date
Element.Description: The date, assigned by the sender, on which this document was issued. Must not include timezone information. Format YYYY-MM-DD

Element.Name: Response information
Element.Description: Response information on the evidence requested for this operator

Element.Name: Criterion response ID
Element.Description: Criterion response identifier

Element.Name: Criterion identifier
Element.Description: This ID MUST point at one of the TenderingCriterionProperty/cbc:ID that were included in the Request document.

Element.Name: Criteria response value identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for this criterion response value. Use UUID from the Crtierion Taxonomy

Element.Name: Criteria response value identifier
Element.Description: Used if the response is a string

Element.Name: Criteria response amount
Element.Description: An amount as evidence

Element.Name: Criteria response code
Element.Description: A code used as evidence

Element.Name: Criteria response date
Element.Description: A date used as evidence. Format = "YYYY-MM-DD"

Element.Name: Criteria response time
Element.Description: A time used as evidence. Format = "hh:mi:ss"

Element.Name: Criteria response identifier
Element.Description: An identifier used as evidence.

Element.Name: Criteria response indicator
Element.Description: An indicator (boolean) used as evidence. Only allowed values are true or false

Element.Name: Criteria response measure
Element.Description: A measure used as evidence.

Element.Name: Criteria response number
Element.Description: A number used as evidence. Use float values to represent percentages (e.g. 0.3)

Element.Name: Criteria response quantity
Element.Description: A quantity used as evidence. Three different types of quantities can be provided. A quantity in a specific unit of measure, a non-negative integer to specify a year, and a generic quantity without any particular unit of measure.

Element.Name: Criteria response URI
Element.Description: A URI used as evidence.

Element.Name: Evidence supplied
Element.Description: Used to identify evidences supplied for the criterion

Element.Name: Evidence identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for supplied evidence

Element.Name: Evidences
Element.Description: Evidences attached

Element.Name: Evidence identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for supplied evidence, must be the same as the identifier in the supplied evidence class

Element.Name: Evidence type code
Element.Description: The type of evidence in this response

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for this document

Element.Name: Attached document
Element.Description: An attached document embedded as binary object (Base64)

Attribute.Name: Attached document Mime code
Attribute.Description: The mime code of the attached document.

Attribute.Name: Attached document Filename
Attribute.Description: The file name of the attached document

Element.Name: External document location
Element.Description: The URL (Uniform Resource Locator) that identifies where the external document is located. A means of locating the resource, including its primary access mechanism, e.g. http:// or ftp://.
